review.body: This book was okay. I guessed by page 50 that she would assist him with what he wanted. I didn't care for the mother at the end (but to give the author credit she kept the character consistent). I don't see what everyone is making such a big to do about this book. It was okay. A cheesy romance no...

I love her books. Once I start them, I can't finish them. I am almost sad that I am finished since her next Maiden Lane book won't be out for another year! What a great story. I love the heroine Artemis (great name). I have enjoyed seeing all of these characters in her previous books. I wonder if...

book.title: Twilight with the Infamous Earl (Lords of Vice, #7)

review.body: I liked it. Easy read. Not as good as the first book in this series. I thought "Frost" would have a more compelling story. I almost feel like the author lost her "oomph" for telling the stories of the last two friends in this series. Maybe there should have only been 4 or 5 friends instead of 7....

book.title: The Trouble With Being a Duke (At the Kingsborough Ball, #1)
I Married the Duke (The Prince Catchers, #1)

review.body: It started out promising. There were too many twists near the end for me to entirely enjoy it.

I am really enjoying books by this author. For the 2nd book in this series, I think it was a stronger story than the first. I thought the heroine was completely believable. I liked how the father asked all three of them to take care of each other and that that was revealed towards the end of the...

Fairytale Ghost

Great romance! Ms . Roberts never fails to entertain with her stories of love. Adding a ghost looking for HER lost love just added more romance to it all!

book.title: If Wishes Were Earls (Rhymes With Love, #3)

review.body: What a fun read! I liked all of the characters. Not sure why she had Oriel/Opheliia as split personality. But I liked that it wasn't a typical romance. Will read more in this series.

book.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

review.body:
Great end to a great series

So many times a series ends with so many things left hanging. This was a nice ending that wrapped it all up. The closure on everyone you meet along the way helps a little in avoiding the inevitable withdrawal when it's all over.

I liked how Makenna and Colin's story unraveled. I felt a bit weird at the beginning knowing he had been married to her sister. Not sure of that part, but it worked out in the end. I will probably read more in this series.

book.title: Why Dukes Say I Do (Wicked Widows, #1)

review.body: I have found this new author and I like her stories. I enjoyed this book and I hope to read the next book in the series. I did like that the maid was the one threatening Isabella and that she (the maid) happened to be her first husband's mistress.
The story reminded me of Hans Christian Andersen's : "Swineherd," only Holly's story has a happier ending for her couple.

book.title: Dancing with the Duke (Landing a Lord, #0.5)

review.body: Very short story, but a good afternoon read.

I liked this one better than the other twin's story. I was a little surprised that the wedding was not the end of the story. I did like her epilogue for the story I know there are two more brother's, but I don't think this author has written their stories yet.

book.title: Renewable: One Woman's Search for Simplicity, Faithfulness, and Hope

review.body: Eileen's story will inspire you to get out of the house and take action--whether it's to combat climate change (her cause) or the cause that most moves you.
